page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The dominant feature of the area is Sandown Bay which offers safe, sandy beaches and a wide range of water sport facilities. There are two piers, Sandown and Shanklin some two miles apart. Sandown is council owned and boasts a modern 900 seater theatre which offers 'big name' variety shows. Shanklin is privately owned and offers discos,slot machines and deckchairs. The two towns,which are major resorts extend along the coastal strip and meet at the village of Lake forming a linear conurbation dividing sea from farm land. Employment,other than tourism,is provided by shops,residential old peoples homes,a very large air conditioning factory and a few small electronic component firms.
